00008 namespace SimSite3D{
00009 namespace geometry{
00010 
00011 class line_t{
00012 public:
00013 #if 0
00014   line_t(const my_float_t* slope, const my_float_t* intercept,
00015          const my_float_t* end_pts = 0)
00016   {
00017     std::copy(slope, slope + 3, A_slope);
00018     std::copy(intercept, intercept + 3, A_intercept);
00019   }
00020 #endif
00021   line_t(const my_float_t* p0, const my_float_t* p1)
00022   {
00023     A_edge_len = unit_vector(A_slope, p0, p1);
00024     std::copy(p0, p0 + 3, A_end_pts);
00025     std::copy(p1, p1 + 3, A_end_pts + 3);
00026   }
00027 
00028   line_t(const my_float_t* end_pts)
00029   {
00030     A_edge_len = unit_vector(A_slope, end_pts, end_pts + 3);
00031     std::copy(end_pts, end_pts + 6, A_end_pts);
00032   }
00033 
00034   ~line_t()
00035   { ; }
00036 
00037   line_t(const line_t& src)
00038   {
00039     do_copy(src);
00040   }
00041 
00042   const line_t&
00043   operator=(const line_t& src)
00044   {
00045     if(this != &src) do_copy(src);
00046     return *this;
00047   }
00048 
00049 
00050   bool
00051   corresponding_point(const my_float_t* pt, my_float_t* pt_on_line,
00052                       const bool line_segment=true)
00053   {
00054     // Get vector from first end_point to pt
00055     my_float_t V[3];
00056     vector(3, pt, A_end_pts, V);
00057 
00058     // Compute the projection of V onto A_slope.  Since A_slope is a unit 
00059     // vector, the projection of the point is the number of units in the 
00060     // A_slope direction from the first end point.
00061     my_float_t proj_pt_dist = dot(V, A_slope);
00062     bool rv = true;
00063 
00064     // CASE 0:  The correspondence is the closest point on the line (not line
00065     // segment) containing (defined by) Vi and Vj.
00066     if(!line_segment){
00067       std::copy(A_end_pts, A_end_pts+3, pt_on_line);
00068       my_axpy(3, proj_pt_dist, A_slope, 1, pt_on_line, 1);
00069   
00070     // CASE 1:  The projection of the point must be contained in the line 
00071     // segment.  If the projection is not contained in the line segment, set
00072     // the corresponding point as the closer of the two end points and return
00073     // false to denote the correspondance is not contained in the line segment.
00074     }else{
00075       if(proj_pt_dist < 0.0){
00076         std::copy(A_end_pts, A_end_pts + 3, pt_on_line);
00077         rv = false;
00078       }else if(proj_pt_dist > A_edge_len){
00079         std::copy(A_end_pts + 3, A_end_pts + 6, pt_on_line);
00080         rv = false;
00081       }else{
00082         std::copy(A_end_pts, A_end_pts+3, pt_on_line);
00083         my_axpy(3, proj_pt_dist, A_slope, 1, pt_on_line, 1);
00084       }
00085     }
00086   
00087     return rv;
00088   }
00089 
00090 private:
00091   void
00092   do_copy(const line_t& src)
00093   {
00094     std::copy(src.A_end_pts, src.A_end_pts + 6, A_end_pts);
00095     std::copy(src.A_slope, src.A_slope + 6, A_slope);
00096     A_edge_len = src.A_edge_len;
00097   }
00098  
00099   my_float_t A_end_pts[6];
00100   my_float_t A_slope[3];
00101   my_float_t A_edge_len;
00102 
00103 //  my_float_t A_intercept[3];
00104 };
